episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of intriguing topics, including the hypothetical disappearance of bacteria, the world's largest wine cellar in Moldova, the history of the British royal family's surname, and the theft of a ski lift in the Czech Republic.

facts.fact: If all the bacteria in the world disappeared, we wouldn't notice for about a week.
The world's largest wine cellar has tunnels 150 miles long, and it's so big it has to have traffic rules for people who drive through it.
Before they settled on the name Windsor, surnames that were considered for the royal family included Guelph, Wettin, Tudor Stuart, and England.
In 2012, thieves stole an entire ski lift from the Czech Republic.
